DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether transcutaneous electrical stimulation apply abdominal wall muscle synchronous voluntary exhalation use reduce hyperinflation patient chronic obstructive pulmonary disease .
DOC.brief_title: Abdominal Functional Electrical Stimulation Reduce Hyperinflation Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Patients
DOC.criteria: Postbronchodilator FEV1/FVC ratio le 0.7 postbronchodilator FEV1 30 80 % predict . Current former smoker least 20 pack year smoke history Over age forty Female subject pregnant Subjects unable give inform consent Subjects unable perform require activity study ( e.g . Six minute walk test ) Subjects implanted electronic device ( e.g . cardiac pacemaker ) Subjects chronic obstructive pulmonary disease exacerbation within 30 day prior enrollment Considerable arthritic change limit exertion Patients oral prednisone Patients hernia Patients history pneumothorax within last 5 year History epilepsy History Abnormal electrocardiogram suggestive cardiac disease
